reviews.text: Came to taste Japanese cuisine and the famous Ramen, and it was a disappointment. Regarding the service, I am surprised by this inability to smile and come and see if everyone is okay. For the atmosphere, no decoration apart from two Japanese panels. Plus it was super cold, even the waiter kept his down jacket on 🤣. For my part, a Restaurant is a moment of well-being and relaxation, of discovery and flavor. We are far from that here. Huge disappointment.  I have trouble understanding why such high scores?Food: 2Service: 1Atmosphere: 1

reviews.name: Abdel-Hakim BEN OUIREN
reviews.text: I recently had the pleasure of enjoying a meal at a Japanese restaurant, and the experience was nothing short of delicious. The vegetarian ramen was a treat for the taste buds, with a wonderfully balanced broth and vegetarian dumplings that added a touch of deliciousness. The accompaniment of an exceptional jasmine tea added a refreshing note to the entire meal.  What really made this experience stand out was the attention to detail. Every element of the meal seemed prepared with care and passion. The atmosphere of the restaurant was welcoming, creating a pleasant ambiance to savor every bite.  To top it off, the mango mochi for dessert was a perfect classic, offering a sweet and light note to end the meal in style. The service was also up to par, with attentive and friendly staff.  Additionally, a particularly nice aspect of this dining experience was the value for money. Despite the exceptional quality of the dishes, the Japanese restaurant was not very expensive, thus providing an exceptional dining experience without putting a strain on the wallet. A great find for those looking for quality cuisine at an affordable price.  In summary, my experience at the Japanese restaurant was memorable, and I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves Japanese cuisine and delicate flavors. A real treat for the senses!ServiceDine inMeal typeDinnerPrice per person€10–20Food: 5Service: 5Atmosphere: 5Recommended dishesSalade de Choux, Raviol de Légumes, Ramen Végétarien

I found that the gyozas could have benefited from being a little more grilled. The quantities are very good and the taste is really there.ServiceTake outMeal typeLunchFood: 4Service: 4Atmosphere: 4Recommended dishesRamen VégétarienVegetarian optionsThere are several dishes that do not contain meat (vege ravioli ramen, vege ramen and other side dishes). The cuisine is good though, the dishes are tasty and very traditional. The waitress acceded to our requests (high chair, heating of the baby's dish). An address to remember.
